summary.para: The GetOutputCompatibilityIndex method retrieves the setting for the AVI index format.

param.name: pfOldIndex
param.para: Receives one of the following values.

remarks.para: The AVI Mux filter always creates an AVI 2.0 index ('indx' format). If the value returned in pfOldIndex is TRUE, the AVI Mux also creates an AVI 1.0 index ('idx1' format), for backward compatibility with Video for Windows.

summary.para: The SetMasterStream method specifies a stream that will be used to synchronize the other streams in the file.

param.name: iStream
param.para: Specifies the index of the stream, or –1 to indicate no master stream. The AVI Mux writes one stream for each connected input pin. Stream numbers are indexed from zero.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: If you are capturing audio and video from two different sources, use this method to synchronize the streams. Streams coming from separate capture sources may be captured at slightly different rates. If you specify a master stream, the AVI Mux adjusts the playback rates for the other streams, to compensate for any drift that might occur.

It is recommended to use the audio stream as the master stream, because minor adjustments to the video playback rate are less noticeable than changes to the audio playback rate. Also, modifying the audio playback rate will cause the audio to be resampled by the audio driver.
This method works by adjusting the dwScale and dwRate values in the AVISTREAMHEADER structure.

summary.para: The SetOutputCompatibilityIndex method sets the AVI index format.

param.name: fOldIndex
param.para: Specifies one of the following values:

item.description: Create an AVI 1.0 index, as well as an AVI 2.0 index.
Create an AVI 2.0 index, but not an AVI 1.0 index.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error code otherwise.

remarks.para: The AVI Mux filter always creates an AVI 2.0 index ('indx' format). If the value given in fOldIndex is TRUE, the AVI Mux also creates an AVI 1.0 index ('idx1' format), for backward compatibility with Video for Windows.
The AVI 2.0 index format allows for larger files, incremental growth of files, and minimized disk seeks.

summary.para: The IConfigAviMux interface configures the AVI Mux filter. Applications can use this interface to set the master stream and to create an AVI 1.0 index.
